text:
Many residents of DC cannot effectively #quarantine at home because they live closely together in apartments and row houses or are experiencing homelessness. 

We’re caring for people especially vulnerable to #coronavirus by arranging private hotel rooms for isolation. https://t.co/3LZgl1UjBP

If you have a fever, cough or shortness of breath, you may qualify for GW's drive-through coronavirus testing.

By appointment only. For more information, call 202-741-2765 or go to https://t.co/FWpRMIXn7V https://t.co/eDe2CwhFzu

Troubled by the two deaths at Hope Village in 3 days.

I have asked @USFederalPrison to release as many inmates as possible and appropriate and to conduct a site visit at Hope Village. 

See my letter below: https://t.co/0POoFvugl3
I will continue to monitor and work with @USMarshalsHQ to ensure they have what is necessary to protect all involved in the D.C. justice system. (2/2)
Appreciate @USMarshalsHQ’s prompt response to my letter to reassure me that inmates are being protected against #coronavirus while making appearances at @DC_Courts. (1/2)

The Kennedy Center got the money but not the message: Pay people – musicians and staff. 
 
Not your call to pick priorities over people. 
 
https://t.co/IvSz92vNab

DC small businesses can now apply to @SBAgov-approved lenders for Paycheck Protection Program loans for payroll, rent, mortgage, and utilities. 

Loans forgivable if payroll and wages maintained. 

Learn more here: https://t.co/CgOLkfMRUa https://t.co/KTSKo43c0R

The next #coronavirus bill is the time for Congress to finally permit DC to commercialize recreational marijuana. It is legal to possess two ounces but #DC can’t tax it. 

Commercialization would help DC in this moment of great need for revenue. https://t.co/xhEOyY1mbS https://t.co/3haXv1L8Wf
The House is working on a 4th bill now and at today’s press conference,Pelosi mentioned several things she wants in it.

At her press conference today, @SpeakerPelosi said #DC was “cruelly discriminated against” when the 3rd Republican-initiated #COVIDー19 bill deliberately shorted DC by $750 million.

Her continuing, spontaneous outspoken support will help me retrieve our funds.

Stop, Look, Listen: 81 years ago today, #MarvinGaye was born at Howard University Hospital. The wisdom in his love songs spans generations.

Mercy mercy me, I heard it through the grapevine that distant lovers are the best kind right now. #socialdistancing https://t.co/bkaktrGlty

In her press conference call yesterday, @SpeakerPelosi said "We need to do more... for the District of Columbia, which was *cruelly* treated in this past bill."

We are at work with House and Senate leaders to make sure the next #coronavirus bill fully funds #DC. https://t.co/itKcZUNTsN

Thank you @ChrisVanHollen, @SenatorCarper + 23 others who wrote to Sen. leadership asking for full DC #coronavirus relief funding.

I'm working to retroactively fund DC in the next coronavirus bill. My constituents and I greatly appreciate the support from so many Senate allies.
BOP also granted my request to waive the 25% subsistence fee charged to halfway house residents during this crisis. We’re all in this together, wherever we happen to be.

To protect DC residents in custody , I asked @USFederalPrison to go to Hope Village, a halfway house, to ensure residents there are safe from the #coronavirus.  BOP reports no COVID-19 cases at Hope Village.

Today is #CensusDay.

Go to https://t.co/gRvWTZvSHt, spend ten minutes and fill out the form today. 

#BeCounted and ensure D.C. gets the funds we're due.
As the first female chair of @USEEOC and the lawyer in the Newsweek sex discrimination case, I’m going for even more in Congress. (2/2)

Today, #EqualPayDay, we remember the House passed my Pay Equity for All Act, barring employers from asking applicants their salary history, to avoid building in widespread intentional or even unintentional race and sex discrimination. (1/2)

In recognition of #TransVisibilityDay, we are thinking about our transgender residents. During #coronavirus, it is particularly important that transgender individuals are able to receive equal access to healthcare. https://t.co/J0S9anHx9j

Thank you @speakerpelosi for reiterating this week that retroactively fixing the outrageous treatment of DC as a territory in the 3rd coronavirus response bill is a top House priority for the 4th bill.  This unprecedented treatment cost DC $750 million. 
https://t.co/VLIieFVSol

Physically distant yet socially connected, we shall overcome.  New stay-at-home order issued by @MayorBowser yesterday—stay inside unless it is essential to go out.  We must do more to flatten the curve. See here for limited exceptions: https://t.co/JP4QoKTkFS https://t.co/Azo97b1kGB

While hospital infrastructure throughout the U.S. struggles to meet the surging demand from coronavirus patients, Trump is busy building his wall. Where are his priorities?
https://t.co/Ng4V3yYMEh

This is why we must always put workers first -- Senate and House Democrats have expanded unemployment benefits and direct cash assistance for Americans. 

Now, I am fighting to ensure D.C. is NOT left out of full funding in the next package.

#FundDCtoFight coronavirus. https://t.co/IwnmvVKlce

Let's pause to celebrate the life of Rev. Joseph Lowery, who was a chief lieutenant of MLK and a mentor to me as a young woman in the civil rights movement.

#RevLowery belonged to the generation that led the way.

https://t.co/98fS8CBmyI

Thank you @postopinions for condemning the unprecedented, shameful treatment of DC by Senate Republicans and White House in the 3rd #coronavirus bill costing DC $750 million.

I’m already at work on fixing this unprecedented denial of funds in next bill.

https://t.co/gxiFwYZqkv
RT @TransportDems: Over 600,000 cases of #coronavirus have been reported around the world. There's no doubt this global pandemic has brough…

RT @ProfJeffries: A lion sleeps tonight.

#JosephLowery
https://t.co/MA7Z2EJWBA

DC always receives state funding but the Senate initiated COVID-19 bill signed today lumps DC with the territories, reducing DC's funds. 

This will not stand. 

Thank you House leaders @SpeakerPelosi and @LeaderHoyer for helping me fix this in the next bill.

I urge you to take three minutes to listen to Senator @ChrisVanHollen’s extraordinary advocacy for DC after we got shortchanged in the 3rd COVID-19 bill with no representation in the Senate. 

This crisis makes the case for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/a10UQNbj1H

We always have to fight to preserve DC home rule, but we always get the same per capita federal funding as states. The Senate reversed that, shortchanging DC in the 3rd COVID-19 bill. This will not stand.
 
See my full statement here: https://t.co/pQmTLgd1Jk
RT @rollcall: "It’s unprecedented" — D.C. Del. @EleanorNorton on coronavirus funding snub https://t.co/vTNs75RwrF https://t.co/0S45ltuzw3

Senator @ChrisVanHollen, thank you for your floor speech last night and for fighting with us to fix the provision in the Senate #coronavirus bill that departs from the usual per capita funding for DC, costing DC hundreds of millions of dollars. https://t.co/a10UQNbj1H

Now is not the time to rest. My office is open for business through telework. Keep your emails and calls coming for the actions you want from Congress.

In the last week alone, I’ve taken more than 50 actions. 

See the full list here: https://t.co/8JS9GGMogR

State stabilization fund in Senate coronavirus bill treats DC as a territory, not as a state. Yet DC pays full federal taxes, pays #1 per capita in fed taxes, & is treated as a state in the rest of bill.

Taking immediate action to get 100s of millions of dollars due to DC.
RT @RepYvetteClarke: Grocery shelves across America are empty – and people fear prices will go up. That’s why I led a letter to the largest…

Please stay home to #flattenthecurve. While home, now is a good time to fill out the #2020Census online at the link below and #becounted. 

With #coronavirus, it will be harder to have door-to-door canvassing. Keep us from losing the funds D.C. is due.

https://t.co/6G6OzeQ4xs

Under the House version of the 3rd coronavirus bill, D.C. would get $11 million in new security funding. 

In these unprecedented times, we appreciate that our security needs are being addressed.

This gives us a head start in getting these funds into the final bill.

@FAMMFoundation @AGWilliamBarr @TheJusticeDept @dclinenews Barr has no jurisdiction over state prisons. I wrote him because dc felons are the only local inmates in BOP. These are hard core felons who have committed murder, rape, robber and the like.

After receiving concerning reports last night, I wrote to @DC_Courts and @USMarshalsHQ encouraging them to take additional steps to protect detainees, court personnel, marshals and the public from the coronavirus.  Read my letter below: https://t.co/S4sGefo6Cw

I requested today @TheJusticeDept to apply the #FirstStepAct to D.C. Code felons in @officialfbop, as Congress intended. I worked to make sure D.C. residents were eligible under the Act. Some may be eligible for compassionate release from #coronavirus. See my letter. https://t.co/M7jzAve00u

Today, I urged the U.S. Parole Commission to release D.C. residents and others who pose no risk to public safety in order to protect inmates, staff and the public from the #coronavirus.

Read my letter here: https://t.co/mLEcgUtoRW

I sent a letter today to House leaders to move my bill giving @NatChildrens space in the Reagan Building rent-free, like other museums.

NCM opened in Feb. but closed because of #COVID19.

DC must not be the only major city without a children’s museum. See my letter below: https://t.co/c85Gucex23

I asked @DeptVetAffairs to suspend all filing deadlines for veterans and surviving family members. 30,000 DC veterans shouldn’t risk losing access to critical disability and pension payments after the sacrifices they’ve made. Read my letter below: https://t.co/43vbbgdUMo

Today, I wrote House appropriators to request that they instruct Capitol Police to develop rules and regulations for the safe operation of e-scooters on Capitol grounds.  If strictly regulated, scooters can help DC win the fight against pollution and congestion. https://t.co/LDqm9XGxJB

Today, I wrote to OMB and OPM asking them to give extra leave time to federal workers who have to take care of their families, including children home from closed schools.  Read my letter below. https://t.co/iitoBhGbcH

DC small businesses suffering economic hardship during this pandemic can now apply for @SBAgov Disaster Relief Loans.

Apply online via this link: https://t.co/VS30lW1mct

I sent a letter today to @PeaceCorps Director Jody Olsen requesting much-needed assistance for all our evacuated Peace Corps volunteers as they transition home. They helped others. Now they need our help. See my full press release and letter here. https://t.co/tIO8Gyee4O

Until coronavirus testing is widely available, the National Capital Region, which houses the seat of the federal government, should be one of the priority areas for federally supported testing. https://t.co/An3UjqZO9A
The federal government should lead by example and mandate telework for federal employees and contractors.  Telework will protect these workers and flatten the curve. https://t.co/XsCrckScDA

This article takes me back to when the women of Newsweek chose to fight back.  As assistant legal director at the American Civil Liberties Union, I represented them and we won. They changed journalism itself. 
https://t.co/UUA4Wihnw3

The @DC_Courts are now using authority that my bill – enacted into law in 2012 – gave our courts to delay judicial proceedings in case of emergencies. This authority eases concerns of residents who use our courts and assures both criminal and civil justice stability. https://t.co/5ZtKPTx7yd

My DC National Guard Home Rule Act would give the DC mayor control of the DC National Guard - without the delays we encounter today - just as the governors of the states and territories have control of theirs. https://t.co/TICCLggYkl

Major General Wherley, who was killed in the 2009 Metro crash, was Commanding General of the D.C. National Guard. The bill I introduced last week, named for him, makes the D.C. Guard competitive with other National Guards by providing education benefits for its members.
My staff and I are teleworking, serving D.C. residents at home as if we were in the House, yet the single biggest drop in the market today is another sign that the nation’s response is not enough.

I joined a just-formed Congressional Coronavirus Task Force today to focus quickly on what to do about this new virus. Congress is on recess next week but our offices will keep regular hours using telework. 
https://t.co/Dse9MDYvRR https://t.co/vWHjq5Ngb5

@SenDuckworth @SenatorBraun @SenMcSallyAZ introduced a companion bill to my Women Who Worked on the Home Front WW2 Memorial Act honoring the 18million American women who performed essential tasks during the war. Thank you for this bipartisan bicameral effort!

Working to ensure medical providers and first responders, especially in D.C.–with 10 reported coronavirus cases–are kept safe so they can keep us safe. They need priority for protective gear, such as masks. Watch my hearing questions here: https://t.co/f0u4E39FhR

Remembering my friend, Jim McGrath today.  Jim made a lasting impact on the District of Columbia and its residents as our city’s leading activist for tenants’ rights. See my full statement in the congressional record here:  
https://t.co/Wf2dqjroN0 https://t.co/CxzgnknBnN

Natural Resources Committee passed my Women Who Worked on the Home Front WW2 Memorial Act by unanimous consent! 18 million American women did important work in WW2 & are overdue for this great honor.  Thank you @RepRaulGrijalva and Raya Kenney. Happy #WomensHistoryMonth!

The House is voting today on a War Powers Resolution to ensure no war with Iran without congressional approval.  Yet, despite serving in every war and paying the highest federal taxes per capita, DC residents will have no vote on this resolution.  It’s time for #DCStatehood.

As we celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth, the Natural Resources Committee is marking up my Women Who Worked on the Home Front WW2 Memorial Act. Our country is overdue in honoring the 18 million American women who did indispensable work during WW2.  Thank you @RepRaulGrijalva!

(3 of 3): We are already working in the Senate with more than 100 organizations with a record of getting difficult bills passed.  We are ready for the next hurdle and are on our way to making D.C. the 51st state!

(2 of 3): The #DCstatehood bill is expected to be on the House floor before this summer.  Because we have enough cosponsors to pass the bill with the votes of cosponsors alone, we expect to make history: House passage of the D.C. statehood bill!

(1 of 3): One month ago, the House Oversight Committee voted to send the #DCstatehood bill to the House floor for the first time since 1993, when I got the first-ever floor vote on the bill in the House.
Tomorrow, I will be participating in the @OversightDems’s first hearing on the coronavirus since the District's first case was confirmed on March 7, 2020.
We honor those who died one year ago today in the second Boeing 737 MAX crash by demanding answers from Boeing and the FAA and holding agency officials accountable. https://t.co/aZhARhQIsC
Fortunately, my bill to give D.C. authority to set the pay level for its own local CFO using its own local money does not require D.C. statehood —Only common sense! https://t.co/gx6CCEXqCW

Today I met with Members of @ACOG to discuss maternal mortality rates in DC.  As a member of the Black Maternal Health Caucus, I am a cosponsor of several bills to discover why Black maternal mortality rates are so high. https://t.co/x5mTu4DVwN
@RepAnthonyBrown Thank you, @RepAnthonyBrown for being a proud original cosponsor of our #DCStatehood bill.  The House is expected to pass our bill this year for the first time in American history.

While the Administration seems narrowly focused on the stock market, House Democrats are fighting to ensure free coronavirus testing and paid sick leave.  Making sure Americans are healthy and safe is the best medicine for a drooping Dow Jones

Even @HighPlainsJrnl, an agricultural journal, covered the announcement that DC’s 2nd statue will be placed in the US Capitol this year. DC will now have 2 statues in the Capitol, just like the 50 states. Nationalize the #DCStatehood fight! 

https://t.co/NQlfzWH42A

One year ago this week, we celebrated as H.R. 1 passed the House, marking the first time in U.S. history that either chamber of Congress voted in support of #DCstatehood.  We are now preparing for the House to pass our D.C. statehood bill before this summer!

(2 of 2): It’s absurd that D.C. can’t set the salary of its own CFO using local funds.  My bill puts D.C. in a competitive position to attract and retain high-quality CFOs, while maintaining the independence of this important office.

(1 of 2): To get Congress out of D.C.’s business, we are working on 2 tracks.  Even before statehood, our Free & Equal D.C. bills expand home rule and equality.  I just introduced the D.C. Chief Financial Officer Salary Home Rule Act to give D.C. authority over the CFO’s pay.

Tonight I’m hosting a panel discussion for Women's History Month celebrating the professional accomplishments of queer women. All are welcome! 6:00 PM at the Adams Morgan Community Center. Starting soon!
I warned that sabotaging this vital federal agency would lead to brain drain. Agencies have always kept some staff at the headquarters to keep Congress and agency heads well informed.

This loss to DC is a loss to the American people: The Bureau of Land Management has lost more than half its Washington area employees who were needlessly slated to move out West to enforce a controversial plan to relocate staff. https://t.co/RccQhtebLm

#DCstatehood is now recognized as a defining civil rights issue of our time. Denying representation and self-government to DC residents, who continue to pay the highest per capita federal taxes, and serve in the military, is wrong. It’s time for #DCstatehood.
Thank you to the Clean Budget Coalition – 100 national organizations – for supporting #DCstatehood in your letter to Congress! @goodregs #nopoisonpills #cleanbudget

Great news that the Senate may pass the Restore Our Parks Act. This would be a big win for DC because NPS owns nearly all of our local DC parks. I will work to get it passed in the full House as soon as possible.

A train derailment in the District a few years ago spilled sodium hydroxide, a highly corrosive substance, in a DC neighborhood. At our subcommittee meeting on railroads, I questioned experts about mitigating such risks to District residents. Watch here: https://t.co/pAgCeEhR73

In our Aviation subcommittee hearing, I asked experts about sexual assaults on airplanes. My bill, the AWARE Act, would require the DOJ to report data of sexual assaults on flights. See my questions here: https://t.co/lkG6gRHH9i

Great to meet with National Treasury Employees Union members yesterday. Our public employees serve with great distinction despite hostile practices by the Trump administration. I’m fighting to increase pay and improve recruitment practices for all our federal workforce. https://t.co/SBLCPrcBMn
RT @MFOLDC: We’re here at the Capitol with @EleanorNorton, @51for51, @CJACTIONFUND, @MikvaDC and more calling for action to project DC! htt…

Today the Supreme Court heard oral arguments from Louisiana lawmakers who want to block women from accessing abortion clinics, depriving them of essential health care. Abortion must be safe and legal for everyone. #MyRightMyDecision

#Coronavirus remains a serious health concern. I urge everyone to practice good hygiene to help stop the spread. Wash your hands (20 seconds!), cover your mouth when you cough, and stay home when sick. Stay well! https://t.co/lk4TXgc7Rt
Today my office hosted the @Nationals’ World Series trophy. We are so proud of our Nats. Congratulations on the historic victory! https://t.co/q6qIONjEu5

Paying the price for #coronavirus: Trump and the Republican Congress eliminated the office for pandemic preparedness that Obama created. With more than 100 cases nationwide, the Democratic House is making up for lost time, proposing emergency spending of close to $8 billion. https://t.co/ZWy70aNFey

I introduced a bill to provide federal tax incentives for businesses to locate and invest in underserved areas of DC, particularly Wards 5, 7 and 8.  Includes a wage credit for hiring workers from neighborhood where business located. https://t.co/uN1IZuZE7P

In 2018, Trump and the Republican Congress abolished the office and the emergency funding Obama created to address outbreaks like the #coronavirus.  Catch up won’t work with Trump’s request for $2.5 billion when experts say much more is needed. https://t.co/5KfawFRJC6

I’ll be on the House floor around 6:55 pm to speak on the coronavirus.  This week the House must make up for the 2018 elimination of the office and the funding for new threats like the coronavirus by Trump and the Republican Congress.

In 2018, Trump and the Republican Congress abolished the office and the emergency funding Obama created to address outbreaks like the coronavirus.  Catch up won’t work with Trump’s request for $2.5 billion when experts say much more is needed. https://t.co/ZXhRtwx3zi

RT @wamu885: Pierre L’Enfant will join a bronze statue of Frederick Douglass representing D.C. in the National Statuary Hall.

https://t.co…
RT @postlocal: Congress accepts statue of Pierre Charles L’Enfant, ending 12-year standoff with the District https://t.co/iRjIP4hBvn
Breaking ground at The Yards in Southeast DC today – with Phase I already bringing millions of dollars in housing, amenities, new businesses, and revenue for the District. https://t.co/iJeVfSoAUY

JUST IN: Historic news as @SpeakerPelosi announced DC will have two statues on display in the Capitol -- just like all the 50 states. More momentum before our #DCstatehood bill is considered on the House floor! https://t.co/o6EbC6IELK
Thank you to the River Terrace Civic Association for a great turnout and excellent discussion last night! https://t.co/k9s7q6pltM

I am urging DC residents to visit my website for resources that will help them file their taxes. The last day to file is April 15th, but residents should begin the process early. Resources can be found here. https://t.co/1upyytneNg
RT @staceyabrams: The founding ideals of this nation demand D.C. statehood. The proud American declaration that our government is of, by an…

Today’s @OversightDems hearing on voter suppression hosted two civil rights icons, Diane Nash and Tim Jenkins. We were all members of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC). Their wisdom will help inform today’s work on 21st century voter suppression. https://t.co/VUFSBlLn0h

Thank you @RepSarbanes for joining me in a @thehill op-ed on #DCstatehood. Rep. Sarbanes is also chair of the Democracy Reform Task Force and sponsored HR 1, which included findings endorsing statehood for DC residents. https://t.co/MVbWMf1ALq
Thank you ANC 4B for your valuable feedback and a full house last night! https://t.co/Dh8edy6UlM
Thanks to my bill, passed into law, the National Park Service is now working with DC to refurbish our local parks, most owned by NPS. Great news for Franklin Park! https://t.co/jlf32GLLS5

Today’s roundtable on the difficulties federal employees face in getting security clearances was critical to the thousands of federal employees and applicants I represent. Efficiency and security are not incompatible.

(great photo, @JRWalkinshaw!) https://t.co/YvVnqEp0Q6

CBS recently covered Raya’s fight to establish a national monument honoring the work of women who served this nation but have gone unrecognized. I am proud to have introduced a bill to make this monument a reality!

Congratulations to DC high school student Raya Kenny on the well-deserved national attention for your efforts to honor women who worked on the home front during WWII. Your continuing efforts will help get our bill passed in the House and Senate! https://t.co/k4GARKk4ql

Thank you Fonteneau Senior Wellness Center for a great turnout and conversation today. 

I host “Norton in Your Neighborhoods” across the city. If your organization is interested in learning the latest DC congressional news, please contact my office. https://t.co/rMzP9JpzHi
Well-attended nonprofit forum gave valuable advice to D.C. nonprofits on competing for federal grants. https://t.co/G7lAxokOzs

Last week, the Smithsonian Women’s History Museum Act, which I cosponsored, passed the House. For too long, women’s history has been left out of the telling of our nation’s history. I am proud that this museum is planned in my own district! https://t.co/boTLva47Xj

@SenatorCarper Thank you @SenatorCarper. I am so grateful to you for getting most of the Senate Democrats as cosponsors. We have 100+ national organizations ready to help move our #DCstatehood bill in the Senate following House passage.

The Census will determine how billions of dollars in federal funds are allocated. A warning to DC: in years past, the District has suffered from a costly undercount. I recently asked officials what plans they have to ensure an accurate count. https://t.co/iUSamWwNbp

Congratulations David Gibson Jr. of @SportsMarkit for your recent Evolve Entrepreneurship Award. DC has a thriving small business community and I’m thrilled to see one of our own recognized. https://t.co/o6mNWq5Da8
Thank you @EricHolder for adding your voice, as one of DC’s most distinguished residents, to our call for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/crCZA394Np

This #BlackHistoryMonth, thank you @ABC7Sam and @ABC7News for capturing some of my work in the South during the Civil Rights Movement. Our rights weren’t given to us – we demanded them. The same could be said for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/AI9Wetw2BT

Climate change has serious consequences for emergency response – even for animals! From pets to livestock, climate is a threat to our ability to keep communities safe. See my questions from a recent hearing on protecting animals in disaster areas. https://t.co/9JCe5A6RsG

Thank you to @amprog for your recent endorsement of our #DCstatehood bill. Progressive values mean standing up for a representative democracy. D.C. statehood is a key voting and civil rights issue of our time. Onward to the House floor!

As momentum for #DCstatehood continues to gain steam, coverage will only increase. I hope that other Americans see the injustice in their nation’s capital. Let them see that we pay the highest per capita taxes of any jurisdiction, without representation. https://t.co/9IQeMa7Gol
You can read coverage of our historic hearing here. https://t.co/N1ppSIfQ4O

Thank you to the District residents who packed the halls of Congress yesterday. It was thrilling to preside for part of the markup that speeds us to the next historic step – on to the House floor! #DCstatehood https://t.co/Z0sxgd654l
Thank you Chairwoman @RepMaloney for your leadership in helping DC make history with the Committee vote on #DCstatehood. Onward to the House floor! https://t.co/Plsyx7qaBe

RT @SenSchumer: It’s time for #DCStatehood! DC residents deserve full representation at the local level and in Congress.

This bill moving…

HISTORY

The House Committee on Oversight and Reform just passed our #DCstatehood bill.

For the first time since 1993, we are heading to the House floor! 

It's time for #DCstatehood.

This afternoon, I presided during the historic mark up and Committee vote on our #DCstatehood bill. It’s time for #DCstatehood! https://t.co/4RNkSKmLp3

Thank you @RepRaskin for your leadership and this informative history of admitting new states.

For voting rights, for self-government, and for true equality -- it's time for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/kdEZEuS15U
RT @RepDonBeyer: It's like the Founders said: no taxation without representation! #DCStatehood now! https://t.co/FBc6rGuilP

RT @ACLU: DC has 700,000+ residents yet ZERO votes in Congress. It’s time to change that!

Thanks to our champion in the House @EleanorNort…
I am now presiding at the @OversightDems mark up and vote on our #DCstatehood bill. Follow along here --> https://t.co/bUnrmSOSZL
Fact Check: No other democracy in the world deprives its citizens of equal rights just because they live in the nation’s capital. It’s time for #DCstatehood.
700,000 DC residents have no vote in Congress. We pay the most in federal taxes per capita and our residents serve in every military branch. It’s time for #DCstatehood.
RT @RepRaskin: The movement for #DCStatehood has gained historic momentum this Congress and we won’t stop pushing for full equality and vot…
RT @RepDebHaaland: Packed house for the #DCStatehood business meeting in the House Oversight Committee today. @OversightDems https://t.co/y…
Thank you for your leadership, Chairwoman @RepMaloney. It's time for #DCstatehood. https://t.co/FiyKryiXiF
Right now, the @OversightDems are marking up our #DCstatehood bill. Watch it live here! --> https://t.co/bUnrmSOSZL

Reminder to District residents – tomorrow the House Oversight Committee will hold a markup and VOTE on our #DCstatehood bill.

We expect a large turnout, and will have three overflow rooms, but I suggest getting here early. Details below! 
https://t.co/OHjS4Q6OA1
@openletterbot Thank you for your own work. I am a cosponsor of these bills.
RT @NMACCommunity: NMAC partnered with Congresswoman @EleanorNorton (D-DC) to take an #HIV test to raise awareness for National Black HIV/A…

Thank you D.C. veterans for your words on service and sacrifice. The 30,000 veterans in the nation’s capital deserve a vote in the government they fought to defend. This Tuesday, our fight for #DCstatehood will take the next step. https://t.co/qY2xMD5jls

RT @OversightDems: #DCSTATEHOOD ANNOUNCEMENT: For the first time since 1993, #DC Statehood will receive a congressional vote!

The bill, in…
We have just released details for the February 11th mark up and Committee vote on #DCstatehood. https://t.co/OHjS4Q6OA1

Today I attended my first Environmental Subcommittee hearing after requesting to join as a Member. The Trump administration is undermining protections against mercury in our air, posing an extreme threat to our children’s health. I will hold them accountable & demand answers.

Breaking: You heard it from the Floor Manager himself. Thank you @LeaderHoyer for your incredible leadership on #DCstatehood. 

Next Tuesday, the House Oversight Committee will mark up and VOTE on my bill to make DC the 51st state. Then … on to the House floor! https://t.co/sp6ZnQqIfu

“Once again, I ask the Congress to join with me in demonstrating our belief in the right of suffrage.  I renew my request that the principle of self-government be extended and the right of suffrage granted to the citizens of the District of Columbia” -- President Eisenhower, 1956
And in 1956, as Eisenhower called on Congress to bring democracy to DC another time. I was in the Capitol tonight to challenge President Trump to do the same.

In 1955, President Eisenhower led his party again: “I renew my request that the principle of self-government be extended and the right of suffrage granted to the citizens of the District of Columbia.” #DCstatehood

In his 1954 #SOTU address, President Eisenhower said: “In the District of Columbia, the time is long overdue for granting national suffrage to its citizens and also applying the principle of local self-government to the Nation's Capital.” #DCstatehood is 219 years overdue.
President Trump should have followed the example of a well-regarded Republican president. In 1954, President Eisenhower raised the bar for equality for DC. #DCstatehood #SOTU
